clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Methotrexate Given to Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis Patients Based on Pharmacogenomics and Pharmacometrics
clinical_study.official_title: Individual Study of Methotrexate Based on Pharmacogenomics and Pharmacometrics

lead_sponsor.agency: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

clinical_study.source: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: This study will integrate Pharmacogenomics and Pharmacometrics, to explore an effective concentration of MTXPGn for JIA pediatric patients, and set up a Population Pharmacokinetics model to provide reference for individual administration on JIA pediatric patients.

detailed_description.textblock: In order to find out "The critical reasons for individual variances in MTX of JIA pediatric patients and quantize the influence of these factors", based on early research, this study will integrate Pharmacogenomics and Pharmacometrics, to explore an effective concentration of MTXPGn for JIA pediatric patients, and set up a Population Pharmacokinetics model to provide reference for individual administration on JIA pediatric patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients with Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
- 7.5-10mg/m2 per week per dose of methotrexate
- all patients have been treated with methotrexate at least for 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- co-treated other drugs which can interact with methotrexate
